intro: Neobotrydium cristatum, commonly known as the cristate lily, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, nodding flowers that resemble lilies, with a unique, crested appearance on its petals. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude cloud forests. Its foliage consists of broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery down. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Neobotrydium cristatum is considered a species of conservation concern.
